etymology.description: 扌(扌) (shǒu, 'hand') + 喬(喬) (qiáo, phonetic) = stirring motion with the hand -> to stir
etymology.interpretation: The character 攪 (jiǎo, 'stir') combines the 扌(扌) (shǒu, 'hand') radical, indicating an action performed by the hand, with 喬(喬) (qiáo), which serves as the phonetic component, together representing the act of stirring.
etymology.simplification: The simplified form 搅 replaces the phonetic component 喬(喬) (qiáo) with 丩(jiū), which has a similar sound, reducing the complexity of the character.

examples.chinese: 他搅动了汤(他攪動了湯)。
她用勺子轻轻搅(她用勺子輕輕攪)，糖浆变得浓稠(糖漿變得濃稠)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng sháo zi qīng qīng jiǎo, táng jiāng biàn dé nóng chóu.
examples.english: She gently stirred with a spoon, and the syrup became thick.

examples.chinese: 古人常用木棍搅清泉(古人常用木棍攪清泉)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén cháng yòng mù gùn jiǎo qīng quán.
examples.english: Ancient people often stirred the clear spring water with a wooden stick.
